Package eu.infomas.dropbox

An easy to use, OSGi based Java client for the Dropbox REST API v1, runs on Google App Engine.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Account
    Information about a user's account.
    Credentials
    Credentials holds the key (identifier) and secret token pair used in the OAuth protocol and REST requests.
    DeltaEntry
    A single entry in a DeltaPage.
    DeltaPage
    A page of DeltaEntrys (returned by Dropbox.delta(java.lang.String)).
    Dropbox
    DropBox offers an easy to use interface for working with the Dropbox REST API v1.
    Dropbox.FilesGet
    Builder for the Dropbox.filesGet(java.lang.String) service.
    Dropbox.FilesPut
    Builder for the Dropbox.filesPut(java.lang.String) service.
    Dropbox.Metadata
    Builder for the Dropbox.metadata(java.lang.String) service.
    Entry
    Entry describes the metadata of a Dropbox file or folder.
    Request
    Request holds all data for a HTTP(S) REST Request.
    Request.Builder
    The builder for Request instances.
    RestClient
    RestClient defines the interface for a simple HTTP(S) REST client, used by Dropbox.
    SimpleRestClient
    SimpleRestClient is a basic implementation of the RestClient interface, based on java.net so it can be used without problems with Google App Engine.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ThumbFormat
    Represents the image format of thumb nails that the API can return.
    ThumbSize
    Represents the size of thumb nails that the API can return.

Package eu.infomas.dropbox Description

An easy to use, OSGi based Java client for the Dropbox REST API v1, runs on Google App Engine.

The main class in this package is Dropbox. It offers the primary interface (facade) to the Dropbox REST API v1.

Why use this library?

Advantages of using this library instead of the official implementation:
  • Works (and tested) on Google App Engine (this was the primary reason for creating this library)
  • Swappable HTTP Client implementation
  • Smaller library, works default with java.net package
  • More clear (fluent) API
  • Artifact is OSGi compliant bundle
  • Faster because json-smart is used instead of json-simple

Example. Get the first 8 bytes of a file.

 /*
 Credentials are stored in a Properties File, format:
 # Properties for Dropbox application
 # Application credentials are mandatory
 dropbox.app.key={key}
 dropbox.app.secret={secret token}
 # Access credentials are optional. If not present the API offers operations to 
 # query Access credentials / tokens
 dropbox.access.key={key}
 dropbox.access.secret={secret token}
 # Language is optional, default is "en"
 dropbox.language=nl
 */
 final Dropbox dropbox = new Dropbox("~/.dropbox.config");
 final ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream(8);
 dropbox.filesGet("dropbox file path")
     .withRange(0, 7) // from (inclusive) - to (inclusive)
     .toOutputStream(baos);

Example. Request metadata for a file or directory.

 Dropbox dropbox = new Dropbox("path-to-your-dropbox-configuration-file");
 Entry entry = dropbox.metadata("/path-to-file-or-directory")
     .withList()
     .asEntry();
 // do something with the Entry
 if (entry.getMimeType.startsWith("image/")) {
     ....
 }
Since:
infomas-asl 3.0.2
Author:
Ronald K. Muller
